page.title: 01BO'NESS
page.content: This block consists mainly of the River Forth but a small strip of land is included in it. This land forms the eastern part of the burgh of Bo'ness. The area was once three small villages Carriden, Grangepans and Bridgeness which are now part of Bo'ness. Grangepans is so called as salt was panned from the R.Forth here. Most of the foreshore is an industrial area although there is a right of way beside the river.The industries are foundries, engineering & woodyards. Two items of historical interest are in this area.The Scottish Railway Preservation Society who have their headquarters and rolling stock here. The other is Antonine's Wall.It began at Carriden and ran through Bo'ness. There are 5 primaries in Bo'ness; the Grange and St.Mary's are in this area. There is 1 secondary, Bo'ness Academy.
